ab.p:
Nor were these my only visions, the
raising of ghosts or devils ^was a promise liberally accorded by
my favourite authors; the fulfilment of which I most eagerly sought;
& if my incantations were always unsuccessfulattributed the failure rather to my own inexperience
and mistake, than ^to a want of skill ^or fidelity in
my instructors.

The natural phænonema that takes
place every day before our eyes did not
escape my examinations.
– stillation of which
my favorite authors were utterlyno ignorant
excited my astonishment, but my utmost
wonder was engaged by some experiementson an air pump
which I saw employed by a gentleman whom
we were in the habit of visiting.

The ignorance of my philosophers on these
and several other points, served to decrease
